meanings.definition: To grow too large for something
meanings.sent1: The puppy quickly outgrown its tiny bed.
meanings.sent2: The child had outgrown his favorite shoes and needed new ones.
meanings.sent3: The plant outgrown its pot and needed a bigger home.
meanings.sent4: Her ambitions had outgrown her current job.
meanings.sent5: The tree had outgrown the fence, reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: To surpass in growth or development
meanings.sent1: The athlete outgrown all his competitors in speed.
meanings.sent2: The company had outgrown its rivals in market share.
meanings.sent3: The sunflower outgrown the other flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His talent had outgrown the small town he grew up in.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outgrown all previous records for distance traveled.

meanings.definition: To become too old or mature for something
meanings.sent1: She had outgrown her childhood fear of the dark.
meanings.sent2: The teenager had outgrown his love for cartoons.
meanings.sent3: The toy car was sad to be outgrown by the child.
meanings.sent4: His taste in music had outgrown the songs he used to love.
meanings.sent5: The student had outgrown the need for constant reassurance from the teacher.
